advanced: To apply **advanced parameters** please read this wiki page more info <http://docs.obs.ninja/advanced-settings>
audio: Learn more about OBS Ninja stereo modes and audio quality here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vS7Up5jgXPcmg_tN52JLgXBZG3wfHB3pZDQWimzxixiuRIDbeMdmU11fgrMpdYFT6yy4Igrkc9hnReY/pubhtml
bug:
If you've found a bug I'm sure Steve would love to fix it as soon as possible. There's a currently two ways we'd prefer you doing this.
**Prefered way:**
 Using github helps Steve track bugs easier, and increases the chance that something gets fixed.
<https://github.com/steveseguin/obsninja/issues>

**Alternative way:**
If you don't have a github account, or want to make one you can head over to #bug-report and write your report.
**Please remember to include the following:**
**1.** What happened?
**2.** What did you expect to happen?
**3.** What steps do you take to re-produce the bug?
**4.** What's your *operating system*?
**5.** What *software/browser* are you using?
**6.** Which branch of OBS.Ninja did it happen on?

 **Thanks for your contribution**
cache:
Sometimes browser cache can become troublesome, especially when new releases come out.
Force reload your browser to clear site cache.

Chrome / Firefox on windows
	CTRL + ⇧ + R
	CTRL + F5
Chrome / Firefox on macOS
	⇧ + reload button
	⌘ + ⇧ + R
common:
Here's a compiled list of some of the most **common issues:**
<https://github.com/steveseguin/obsninja/wiki#common-errors-and-known-issues>
Look through them and see if there's a way you can fix the issue you're having!
contact: If you want to contact Steve, he can usually be found on Discord throughout the day. If you have a private matter and need support he is also available on email at **steve@seguin.email**
cpu:
Encoding: Currently OBS.Ninja doesn't hardware encode most outgoing streams. Exceptions are some mobile devices and laptops that can offload H.264 encode from the CPU.
Decoding: If everything is OK, your GPU should decode incoming OBS.Ninja streams.
discord: Invite link for the **OBS.Ninja discord:** http://docs.obs.ninja/discord
donate:
**Thank you** for considering supporting the project. Any donation helps cover the server costs for the community and prolongs the development of OBS.Ninja. <:obsninjaheart:708271382190096395>
https://docs.obs.ninja/getting-started/sponsor
faq: Before you ask a question about what OBS.Ninja is or how it works, please make sure it isn't already answered on the FAQ page! http://docs.obs.ninja/faq **Thank you!**
firefox: **Firefox** isn't officially supported. If it works, then great! But for support please use **Chrome** for windows. If you find major issues with Firefox feel to report but them but please *do not* expect them to get fixed immediately.
github: **OBS.Ninja's** source code is hosted at <https://github.com/steveseguin/obsninja/> and is open to community development. Feel free to submit a PR for small code contributions or get in-touch for greater involvement. While you are welcome to fork the repo, we will not support older code while we are still in a phase of early rapid-development.
hwaccel: Check your Hardware Acceleration status for browser sources: https://i.imgur.com/z8WoME1.png
iphone: The iPhone's h264 hardware encoder can only do 720p30.  Beyond that it's not compatible.  If you want 1080p, on compatible/newer iOS devices, you can use the &codec=vp8 to get 1080p capture -- however a older iPhone like a 6S,  might not be realistic as it will use the CPU to encode... and an iPhone 6S might struggle there. iPhones don't handle large group rooms that well, especially older iPhones. iPhone is limited to 3 h264 streams
latest:
Check out the over-all changes for the **latest version of OBS.Ninja:**
https://docs.obs.ninja/new
limit: There is no self imposed limit on the number of OBS.Ninja guests able to enter a room. It's up for you to decide how many people your system can handle. Remember that OBS.Ninja is a peer to peer n-to-n connection. Meaning if you have 5 people in a room, all 5 people will be connecting to other 4. This can severely limit your options, since every connection is a new encoding load. There are ways to optimize CPU usage by reducing total room bitrate, or outputting only the OBS feed into a room, and feeding that to all guests. Check !advanced for more info.
macos: Please update OBS to at least v26.1.2. This release has a very important couple of fixes that makes using OBS.Ninja in macOS possible. Download: https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/releases/tag/26.1.2
new:
Check out the over-all changes for the **latest version of OBS.Ninja:**
https://docs.obs.ninja/new
packetloss:
High packet loss from WiFi or other network issue is the main reason for low quality streams. The Electron Capture app works better than OBS if packet loss is an issue.
Be sure to rule out non-internet issues like the guest being on low battery or in dim-environments causing low frame rates on many laptops.
If using the !electron capture app, adding &buffer=200 can help mitigate some issues.
If using OBS, try switching the video codec by using &codec=vp9 or &codec=h264 on the view link.

Watch this video to learn more about how to reduce packet loss: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=je2ljlvLzlY
permanent: For information on permanent links, please see: https://docs.obs.ninja/common-errors-and-known-issues/how-to-get-permanent-links

reddit: The **official reddit** page for updates and discussions about OBS.ninja can be found at https://www.reddit.com/r/OBSNinja/
software: The technologies used in the creation of OBS.ninja are application agnostic. It doesn’t know how the output URL is being used. To that end, any software that can use a browser based source should be capable of using the output URL provided by obs.ninja. However, OBS.ninja is only officially tested using OBS (obsproject.com), and functionality developed to address the needs of that user base.
speedtest:
$1 you can check your obs.ninja performance here: <https://obs.ninja/speedtest>
This will send your video/ audio feed to OBS.Ninja's server and back. It is then possible to check for some metrics like bitrate, packet loss or buffer.

support: If you need help regarding OBS.Ninja please use the appropriate channel for your operating system: #windows-support, #macos-support, #linux-support, #general-support, #mobile-support. Please make sure you provide as much detail as possible to your issue and circumstances!
supported:
**Supported browsers/OS:**
Chrome Windows
Chrome Android
Chrome MacOS
Safari iOS
Chromium Linux
**Not officially supported browsers/OS:**
Firefox Windows
Safari MacOS
**Note:** Just because something isn't supported doesn't mean it won't work - just don't expect bug fixes or compatibility.
wifi:
If at all possible, switch to ethernet. If not... well:
- Use the !electron capture app instead of OBS, then window capture it into OBS.
- If using the !electron capture app, you can do &buffer=200 to mitigate issues
- If Packet Loss is hurting your stream (test at !speedtest), try using Speedify - <https://speedify.com>. It can help, especially if you can bond WiFi with LTE. (Redundant / bonded mode)
- Try adding '&privacy' to your URL which might reduce packet loss.
- Physically move closer to your router.
- Don't have more clients on the network; put others on LTE if you must be on WiFi
- If you can, don't be on battery, connect your device.
- Don't expect flawless  high resolution, high bitrate feeds. Reduce your requirements. Try 720p or even lower.
- Consider limiting FPS
- VP9 or H264 works better than VP8 within OBS
- Avoid bluetooth.
- Be ready to 'reconnect' failed audio connections/tracks
- Close all other non essential apps
